name: Rack Deadlift
how_to_perform:
1. Stand over the barbell with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands gripping the bar with an overhand grip, taking care to hook your thumbs under the bar.
2. Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, hinge forward at the hips until your legs are bent slightly and your body is in line with the bar.
3. Lift the bar off the rack by squeezing your glutes and pushing through your heels, keeping your back flat and your chest up.
4. Stand up to the starting position, keeping the bar close against your shins as you lift your hips up towards the ceiling.
5. Lower the bar to the rack in a slow and controlled manner, taking care not to lose control of the weight or touch the ground with your body.
6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Rack deadlifts are a variation of the deadlift exercise that involves lifting a weighted barbell from a racked position without reaching full hip extension.
